snippet: The site appears easier to use for most people, but problems in the systems that deliver consumer information to insurers still have not been fixed.
abstract: Weeks of frantic technical work have made government's health care Web site easier to use for consumers, but significant problems remain with back end system that delivers consumer information to insurers; insurance companies warn that they have received flawed data, or no data whatsoever, for a large number of applicants whose coverage is slated to begin in January.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and REED ABELSON
byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood, Dan Frosch and Jennifer Preston contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The site appears easier to use for most people, but problems in the systems that deliver consumer information to insurers still have not been fixed.

headline.main: Insurers Claim Health Website Is Still Flawed
headline.print_headline: Insurers Claim Health Website Is Still Flawed

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
